course_title: Advanced Topics in Film and Media Studies: Media Texts and Technologies
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 20 / Seats Avail: 7Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: An advanced seminar on the relationship between media authorship and technology. In this course, we will discuss how the platforms and apparatuses underlying media create the conditions for authorship. How do cameras, projectors, game consoles, televisions, and distribution channels inflect the media forms that they make possible? How do media technologies facilitate and constrain the creative endeavors of media makers? Starting from an initial basis in cinema and film theory, we will go on to explore this relationship in media such as video games, television, and video.
course_description: This course is designed to give advanced students the opportunity to investigate intensively a specialized topic in film and media studies. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
prerequisites: FILM 301 or FILM 301W or FILM 302 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
